title: Park Circus Expands into France with Warner Classics Library, Unveils Gem-Studded LumiÃ¨re Festival Slate (EXCLUSIVE)
description: U.K.-based repertory powerhouse Park Circus has secured French distribution of Warner Bros.â€™ classic film library, CEO Doug Davis confirmed toÂ Varie
body:
U.K.-based repertory powerhouse Park Circus has secured French distribution of Warner Bros.â€™ classic film library, CEO Doug Davis confirmed toÂ VarietyÂ ahead of the International Classic Film Market (MIFC) in Lyon.

	â€œWe will be distributing the Warner Brothers classic film library theatrically in France â€“ this is a brand new territory for us in our Warner Bros partnership. Weâ€™re very honored to be the custodian of these heritage libraries,â€ Davis said.
	

	The arrangement brings the French market into alignment with Park Circusâ€™ existing Warner partnerships in the U.K. and other territories and underlines the growing confidence major studios are placing in the company.


	While Park Circus has long worked with the LumiÃ¨re Film Festival â€“ an eight-day celebration of cinema old and new â€“ and its MIFF, the worldâ€™s biggest market dedicated to heritage film, this edition marks the first time Park Circus is officially partnering with the market.Â 

	For Davis, the timing felt right. â€œI think itâ€™s a combination of the festival and the MarchÃ© going from strength to strength â€“ more delegates, more guests of honor. Our mission in life is to bring classic films back to the big screen, primarily where they belong,â€ he said.

	For LumiÃ¨re, Park Circus has unveiled a 24-title lineup, including Michael Mann titles â€œHeatâ€ and â€œThief,â€ tied to the directorâ€™s LumiÃ¨re Prize tribute this year, along with Sean Pennâ€™s â€œInto the Wild,â€ screening in connection with his appearance as guest of honor at the festival.Â 
	

	More than a dozen titles are films by Martin Ritt, ranging fromÂ  â€œThe Spy Who Came in From the Coldâ€ and â€œParis Bluesâ€ to â€œMurphyâ€™s Romanceâ€ and â€œNuts,â€ as part of LumiÃ¨reâ€™s celebration of the iconic Hollywood director.

	â€œHeat,â€ which marks its 30th anniversary, will close the festival with a new 4K restoration. â€œThief,â€ also presented in a 4K restored version, is the directorâ€™s cut of the film, supervised and approved by Mann. â€œInto the Wild,â€ though not a restoration, will be screened in a new copy with French subtitles financed by Park Circus, allowing it to circulate through French-speaking territories after the festival.Â  Â 

	The mix of prestige restorations from major studios and rediscovered titles illustrates the scale of opportunity in the heritage market, which extends well beyond festivals and repertory venues: during the pandemic, and later amid the Hollywood strikes, multiplexes turned to classic titles to fill screens, sparking a surge in demand that, according to Davis, has not faded.

	â€œI can happily report that it has not gone away. The multiplexes are quite delighted with the way the classics are performing,â€ he said, noting that the revival attracts not just older audiences but also younger viewers, thanks in part to savvy trailer-based promotion across social media platforms like Letterboxd.

	Davis also cited a recent 4K re-release of Stanley Kubrickâ€™s â€œBarry Lyndonâ€ as an example of how fan-generated content can go viral on platforms like TikTok: Â â€œItâ€™s kind of like vinyl records: Thereâ€™s a social and cultural cachet now to watching old movies and being first to know.â€

	As heritage titles continue to find fresh audiences in multiplexes, Park Circus sees its mission as both cultural and commercial. â€œAs a business, our mission [to grow the audience for the theatrical experience of classic films] is prudent, responsible growth. As a partner to exhibition, itâ€™s helping them attract, retain and delight new audiences. Our growth will continue with existing partners, convincing new partners to try classics, and expanding globally,â€ said Davis.

	The MIFC runs alongside the LumiÃ¨re Film Festival in Lyon over Oct. 14-17.

schema.headline: Park Circus Expands into France with Warner Classics Library, Unveils Gem-Studded LumiÃ¨re Festival Slate (EXCLUSIVE)

title: NFL London Game: How to Watch the Denver Broncos vs. New York Jets Live from England Online
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	With the
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	With the NFL expanding American football outside of the United States, more and more games are taking place overseas to court fans from different countries. The league now travels to England for NFL London Game.

	For Week 6, the Denver Broncos (3-2) battle the New York Jets (0-5) at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in London, England. The game broadcasts on NFL Network on Sunday, Oct. 12, with kickoff at 9:30 a.m. ET/6:30 a.m. PT.


	Want to watch the NFL London Game online? There are a number of ways to watch online.


	Even without cable, you donâ€™t have to miss any of the action. You can access the game livestreams on a number of streaming platforms, including DirecTV, Fubo, Sling TV and Hulu + Live TV. All of these services (with the exception of Sling) offer free trials that you can use to livestream select NFL games online for free.
	
		How to Watch NFL Network Online Without Cable	

	Scroll down and check out the best ways to stream the NFL London Game, below:


						
			
	

					DirecTV
	
					

	DirecTV is one of the best ways for cable-cutters to access live sports and TV from home. Starting at $49.99 for the first month of series ($89.99/month afterwards), you get access to the streamerâ€™s Choice package for NFL regular season games on NFL Network. The service also includes NBC, ABC, ESPN, CBS and Fox for games.


						
			
	

					Sling TV
	
					

	Sling is one of the best options for affordable live streaming with the Sling Blue package, which is half off for the first month of service. The package includes NFL Network for games, analysis, commentary, highlights and more. Please note: Pricing and channel availability are subject to your local TV market.


	Additionally, NFL fans can add the Sports Extra package to their plan for an additional $11/month to gain access to the NFL RedZone network.


						
			
	

					Fubo
	
					

	Fubo is one of the best options for streaming NFL regular season games because itâ€™s the most comprehensive. The service features NFL Network, as well as the other networks that broadcast games, including NBC, ABC, CBS, Fox and ESPN, while it has additional channels for analysis, like NFL Red Zone. It even has more than 230 live TV channels for cable-free streaming. The streamer offers a 7-day free trial to try out the service before you commit.


						
			
	

					Hulu
	
					

	Starting at $82.99/month, Hulu + Live TV is a great option for live channel streaming NFL games with access to NFL Network, along with more than 90 other channels, like NBC, ABC, ESPN, CBS and Fox, as well as access to hit originals on Disney+, Hulu and ESPN Unlimited.


						
			
	

					NFL
	
					

	For die-hard NFL fans, the NFL+ streaming service is a must. It features all games across broadcast and cable networks, including NFL Network, during the regular season, post-season, preseason and even the Super Bowl. It broadcasts 24 hours of everything NFL starting at $6.99/month. Learn more about NFL+ here.

schema.headline: NFL London Game: How to Watch the Denver Broncos vs. New York Jets Live from England Online

title: Jesse WilliamsÂ Starrer â€˜Hotel Costieraâ€™ Hits No. 1 on Prime U.S.: â€˜The Appetite for Bold, Sky-Blue Drama Is Clearâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
Itâ€™s time to check in: â€œHotel Costieraâ€ has hit No. 1Â on Amazon Prime Video in the U.S.Â 

	â€œItâ€™s a huge moment for us all,â€ said Jens Richter, CEO C
body:
Itâ€™s time to check in: â€œHotel Costieraâ€ has hit No. 1Â on Amazon Prime Video in the U.S.Â 

	â€œItâ€™s a huge moment for us all,â€ said Jens Richter, CEO Commercial and International at Fremantle, which is selling â€œHotel Costieraâ€ to bullish results.

	â€œThe appetite for this kind of bold, sky-blue drama is clear â€“ itâ€™s connecting with audiences globally and ticking all the right boxes for buyers. Itâ€™s a great example of premium storytelling with a truly global perspective and appeal.â€
	

	The show follows Daniel De Luca (â€œGreyâ€™s Anatomyâ€ alumnus Jesse Williams), a half Italian former U.S. Marine. Daniel returns to Italy, the land of his childhood, as a fixer in one of the worldâ€™s most luxurious hotels, located on the coastline of Positano.Â 


	In addition to dealing with the wealthy guestsâ€™ problems, Daniel is also on the trail of Alice, one of the ownerâ€™s daughters who disappeared a month earlier. He must do everything he can to bring her home, but facing those who kidnapped the girl will be more challenging than any problem Daniel has ever faced.â€¯

	In an interview withÂ Variety, Jesse Williams admitted he â€œreally loved the [showâ€™s] world.â€Â 

	â€œI think I really gravitated towards this guy who had fully committed himself to something in the military and finds himself having to start over. Heâ€™s also a character whoâ€™s from two worlds. I think there was a relatability factor there, as somebody whoâ€™s American but biracial in a polarized country and authentically of two worlds.â€

	He added: â€œI had been, at the time, wanting to think more about global creativity: thinking outside the borders of the U.S. I always found that interesting. I went to film school, and thatâ€™s the lens through which I see the world. You watch Fellini and youâ€™re learning about other places, like also Korea and Japan, through their cinema. Americans arenâ€™t always known for their ability to open up and process and absorb other cultures.â€
	

	Co-produced by Amazon MGM Studios and Luca Bernabei for Lux Vide, a Fremantle company, â€œHotel Costieraâ€ is filmed in English and directed by Emmy Award winner Adam Bernstein and by Giacomo Martelli. Based on an idea by Bernabei, the series is written by Elena Bucaccio, Matthew Parkhill and Francesco Arlanch.Â 

	Maria Chiara Giannetta, Jordan Alexandra, Antonio Gerardi, Sam Haygarth, Tommaso Ragno, Amanda Campana, Pierpaolo Spollon, Alejandra Onieva and Jean-Hugues Anglade also star.

	â€œWeâ€™d been looking for a story to set on the Amalfi Coast for a long time. Itâ€™s where everyone dreams of living: one of Italyâ€™s most loved spots. Then came the idea of a former U.S. Marine who helps the guests of a luxury hotel solve their problems, and everything fell into place,â€ admitted Bucaccio, co-creator and Head of Drama at Lux Vide.

	â€œWe suddenly had the genre, the perspective and a format we could build on, thanks to the unwavering support of our incredible partners at Amazon Prime Video. â€˜Hotel Costieraâ€™ is set in Italy, but it resonates perfectly internationally, and thatâ€™s its real strength. Hitting No.1 in the U.S. on Prime Video underlines this fact.â€

schema.headline: Jesse WilliamsÂ Starrer â€˜Hotel Costieraâ€™ Hits No. 1 on Prime U.S.: â€˜The Appetite for Bold, Sky-Blue Drama Is Clearâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Amy Poehler and Tina Fey Skewer Pam Bondi and Kristi Noem in â€˜SNLâ€™ Opening, Mock Jeffrey Epstein Files, ICE Agents and Dog-Shooting Scandal
description: The cold open of this weekâ€™s â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ brought in host Amy Poehler and her BFF Tina Fey to play Pam Bondi and Kristi Noem, respectively.
body:
The cold open of this weekâ€™s â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ brought in host Amy Poehler and her BFF Tina Fey to play Pam Bondi and Kristi Noem, respectively.

	The sketch began by portraying part of Bondiâ€™s controversial Senate hearing this week, where the United States Attorney General was grilled and cagey about topics such as the Jeffrey Epstein files.

	When asked if Trump directed her to indict James Comey, the AG was noncompliant.


	â€œIâ€™m not going to discuss my private conversations with the president,â€ Poehler as Bondi said. â€œIâ€™m not telling you who fell asleep in the middle of a sentence, or who kept calling me Ivanka while patting his lap.â€
	

	She also discussed the Jeffrey Epstein files, saying, â€œI tried reading the Epstein files, but I got really bored. Itâ€™s so repetitive. â€˜Trump this, Trump that.â€™ Yawn.â€

	Soon enough, Feyâ€™s Noem entered, complete with an automatic weapon.

	â€œThatâ€™s right, itâ€™s me, Kristi,â€ Noem said during her entrance. â€œI spell my name with an â€˜Iâ€™ because thatâ€™s how I thought it was spelled.â€

	Also Noem gave some insight into the hiring process for ICE, as Fey revealed, â€œHow did I find them? By running ads like this: Do you need a job now? Yeah. Are you a big tough guy? Yeah. Tough enough for the army or police? No. Do you take supplements that you bought at a gas station? Daily. Do you like to use zip ties because people in your life donâ€™t trust you with keys? You know it. Suck on some of these big boy. Welcome to ICE.â€

	Noem also spoke to her much-discussed dog-shooting scandal, saying, â€œThat makes me laugh more than the end of â€˜Old Yeller.'â€ and â€œDogs donâ€™t just get shot â€”Â a hero shoots them.â€
	

	Watch the cold open below.

schema.headline: Amy Poehler and Tina Fey Skewer Pam Bondi and Kristi Noem in â€˜SNLâ€™ Opening, Mock Jeffrey Epstein Files, ICE Agents and Dog-Shooting Scandal

title: Aubrey Plaza Joins â€˜SNLâ€™ â€˜Hunting Wivesâ€™ Parody: Season 2 Amps Up Nudity, Wigs, Lesbian Love and MAGA Shotguns
description:
â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ has taken on the phenomenon of â€œThe Hunting Wivesâ€ â€” and has designed the Netflix hit a second season.

	In a taped piece, hos
body:
â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ has taken on the phenomenon of â€œThe Hunting Wivesâ€ â€” and has designed the Netflix hit a second season.

	In a taped piece, host Amy Poehler and guest Aubrey Plaza lampooned the streaming sensation, as well as the cultureâ€™s reaction to it. (As Poehler caressed Chloe Fineman, the narrator informed us that People magazine said that â€œThe Hunting Wivesâ€ was â€œlike â€˜Call Me By Your Nameâ€™ for women who shop at Bass Pro Shop.â€) What â€œSNLâ€ described as â€œthe straight but lesbian horny Republican murder dramaâ€ begins its hypothetical second season with Poehler (lampooning Malin Akermanâ€™s role) dropping her top and declaring â€œLook what the cat dragged in.â€
	


	â€œSNLâ€ treated â€œThe Hunting Wivesâ€ with love but some degree of scrutiny: The narrator notes the â€œwigs that are doing their best,â€ as Poehlerâ€™s hairpiece shifts around during a love scene with Fineman. A scene in which Fineman and Poehler, among others, draw guns on each other feels sharply drawn.


	Plaza, Poehlerâ€™s co-star on â€œParks and Recreation,â€ joined the sketch as a newbie joining the hunting wives, moving in from California. Though the hunting wives flirt with her excessively, true to form, once they learn she identifies as a lesbian, they distance themselves, in the sketchâ€™s final, stinging joke.

	â€œThe Hunting Wivesâ€ is indeed returning for a second season, per a Netflix announcement in September.

	In a statement about the renewal, creator Rebecca Cutter said, â€œIâ€™m so excited to write these amazing characters again, and I canâ€™t wait to take the audience on another sexy, twisted, batshit crazy ride through Maple Brook.â€

schema.headline: Aubrey Plaza Joins â€˜SNLâ€™ â€˜Hunting Wivesâ€™ Parody: Season 2 Amps Up Nudity, Wigs, Lesbian Love and MAGA Shotguns

title: Banijay Kids & Family Secures Sales for â€˜Once Upon a Timeâ€¦,â€™ Demonstrating Its â€˜Sustained Relevance and Appeal on a Global Scaleâ€™
description: Banijay Kids & Family â€“ behind hit shows â€œTotally Spies!â€ and â€œMr Bean: The Animated Seriesâ€ â€“ has announced new distribution agreements for the lat
body:
Banijay Kids & Family â€“ behind hit shows â€œTotally Spies!â€ and â€œMr Bean: The Animated Seriesâ€ â€“ has announced new distribution agreements for the latest installment of â€œOnce Upon a Timeâ€¦,â€ produced by Procidis.

	Season 8, â€œOnce Upon a Timeâ€¦ The Objects,â€ has been picked up by Puls 2â€™s Puls Kids in Poland, Turkuvaz Media Groupâ€™s childrenâ€™s channel Minika GO in Turkey, TFO in Canada and Radio Television Hong Kong.Â 
	

	Thereâ€™s more good news, however, as earlier seasons â€œcontinue to thriveâ€ with AMC Networks International CNE acquiring Seasons 3 and 7 (â€œLife,â€ â€œPlanet Earthâ€) for multiple Eastern European territories, and SF Studios picking up Season 3 (â€œLifeâ€) for Norway and Sweden.


	Described as an â€œiconic edutainment franchise,â€ the â€œOnce Upon a Timeâ€¦â€ saga was originally created by Albert BarillÃ© in 1978 and has broadcast continuously in France for nearly 50 years.

	â€œIts continued journey across borders, and into new territories, demonstrates its sustained relevance and appeal on a global scale,â€ noted CÃ©cile Cau, SVP Sales, Co-productions and Acquisitions at Banijay Kids & Family.Â 

	â€œThe franchise has an enduring legacy and educational value which stays with viewers for life, sparking curiosity in childhood and continuing to resonate with fans well into adulthood.â€

	BenoÃ®t Di Sabatino, CEO of Banijay Kids & Family and President of Procidis, toldÂ Variety: â€œAt the time it was created, â€˜Once Upon a Timeâ€¦â€™ was revolutionary. Albert BarillÃ© created a unique visual and narrative language that spoke to children and parents alike.â€
	

	Its longevity is rooted in its ability to â€œblend storytelling with education in a way thatâ€™s both engaging and timeless,â€ he argued, â€œmaking knowledge accessible, playful and universal.â€Â 

	â€œThe franchise has always sparked curiosity in children that leaves a lasting impression into adulthood. Whatâ€™s kept it alive is its adaptability, with each new season tackling fresh themes that resonate with contemporary audiences. Every episode is driven by curiosity, pedagogy, and a genuine kindness toward the audience.â€

	Itâ€™s not the end of the decades-spanning story, however.Â 

	â€œThe continued success of â€˜Once Upon a Timeâ€¦â€™ across new territories and platforms shows thereâ€™s still a strong appetite for thoughtful, educational content. With Helene BarillÃ©, we have bold plans to grow and evolve the brand for a new generation. Weâ€™re continuing to keep building on its legacy and introduce it to new generations around the world, both through content and beyond with a growing portfolio of experiences and products.â€

	While every season has a different focus, â€œThe Objectsâ€ takes a fresh look at the everyday items that shape our world.Â 

	â€œItâ€™s a clever way to teach children about science, history and culture through objects they encounter daily. Buyers have responded enthusiastically because the show is accessible and universal, and they value content that smartly combines education and entertainment,â€ assured Di Sabatino. Arguing that the magic of the franchise likes in its storytelling.Â 

	â€œIt doesnâ€™t preach. It entertains. It invites understanding rather than memorization. Humor, poetry and iconic characters make knowledge come alive.â€

	He added: â€œIt has always respected its audienceâ€™s intelligence and is a trusted source of knowledge, which captures childrenâ€™s imaginations. That balance of emotion, narrative and scientific accuracy is what makes it such a timeless model of â€˜edutainment,â€™ long before the term even existed.â€



	

					â€˜Once Upon a Timeâ€¦â€™
									Courtesy of Banijay Kids & Family

schema.headline: Banijay Kids & Family Secures Sales for â€˜Once Upon a Timeâ€¦,â€™ Demonstrating Its â€˜Sustained Relevance and Appeal on a Global Scaleâ€™

title: Spamflix to Revive Brazilâ€™s Cult â€˜Cinema of Desireâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Cult film outfit Spamflix will launch the Cinema of Desire at the MarchÃ© International du Film Classique (MIFC) in Lyon, an ambitious restoration pr
body:
Cult film outfit Spamflix will launch the Cinema of Desire at the MarchÃ© International du Film Classique (MIFC) in Lyon, an ambitious restoration project in collaboration with the Cinemateca Brasileira that reclaims a missing piece of Brazilian film history.

	The Lisbon-based platform is presenting the 4K restoration of â€œThe Magic Eye of Loveâ€ (â€œO Olho MÃ¡gico do Amor,â€ 1982), the first in a trilogy by Ãcaro Martins and JosÃ© Antonio Garcia, within the MIFCâ€™s Re>Birth program â€“ a showcase for heritage titles seeking restoration and distribution partners.Â Â 
	

	â€œThis is the first market where we are showing the project, and itâ€™s very special,â€ Spamflix co-founder Julia Duarte toldÂ Variety. â€œThese films were part of a movement that was ahead of its time and emerged from the desire for freedom under the dictatorship in Brazil.â€


	Set in SÃ£o Pauloâ€™s seedy Boca do Lixo district, â€œThe Magic Eye of Loveâ€ follows Vera, a secretary who discovers a hole in her office wall leading to a neighboring hotel room occupied by a prostitute â€“ a portal that awakens her fantasies and changes her life.

	The film, which won several awards, marked the beginning of the so-called Trilogy of Desire, completed by â€œOnda Novaâ€ (1983) and â€œNaked Starâ€ (â€œEstrela Nua,â€ 1985), with plans to include a fourth film, â€œThe Bodyâ€ (1991), Garciaâ€™s solo work. All four have been digitized by the Cinematica Brasileira.

	The Cinema of Desire project revisits the New Cinema of SÃ£o Paulo (Novo Cinema Paulista) movement, a short-lived but influential wave of independent filmmaking that emerged in the early 1980s. It grew out of the â€œpornochanchadaâ€ movies â€“ a popular genre at the end of Brazilâ€™s dictatorship blending eroticism and comedy â€“ but rejected their sexist moralism, according to Duarte. â€œThis was something more,â€ she said. â€œThey gave a voice to women. While they are not that well known, even within Brazil, these films played an important role in Brazilian cinema,â€ she added, noting that her goal, after this project, is to continue highlighting the work of marginalized Brazilian directors.
	

	Made as Brazilâ€™s dictatorship was losing its grip, these films confronted repression indirectly, turning sensuality into an act of defiance. Duarte sees their work as Brazilâ€™s answer to early [Pedro] AlmodÃ³var, combining the freedom, humor, and the emotional excess of Spainâ€™s Movida MadrileÃ±a with Brazilâ€™s own urban and political tensions.

	The movement itself was short-lived as local exhibitors favored imported titles and commercial pornography. After the state distributor Embrafilme was dismantled in 1990, national production nearly collapsed, silencing a generation of filmmakers.

	The project builds on the momentum of â€œOnda Nova,â€ a queer, erotic comedy about female football players challenging prejudice under Brazilâ€™s dictatorship. The filmâ€™s 4K restoration premiered at the Locarno Film Festival in 2024 and went on to screen at festivals across Europe and Latin America. It was released theatrically in Brazil in March this year and has just signed a U.S. distribution deal with Brooklyn-based Muscle Distribution.

	â€œâ€˜Onda Novaâ€™ is exactly the kind of film that Muscle loves: approachable and fun, yet wickedly subversive and genuinely dangerous in its time,â€ Muscle founder Elizabeth Purchell toldÂ Variety. â€œWeâ€™re thrilled to be working with Spamflix to bring it to North American audiences for the first time ever.â€

	Duarte and her partner Markus Duffner plan to premiere the Cinema of Desire films next year in Brazil, followed by screenings at festivals and cinematheques to coincide with the 20th anniversary of JosÃ© Antonio Garciaâ€™s death and what would have been his 70th birthday.

	For Spamflix, best known as a former VOD platform with a strong focus on cult and avant-garde cinema, Cinema of Desire marks a significant step into the world of film heritage and rights management.

	â€œFor us, itâ€™s the same idea.â€ Duarte explained. â€œThrough our work, we are now also taking care of film heritage, giving visibility to unique works that deserve to be seen again.â€

	â€œThe Magic Eye of Loveâ€ is one of nine films that will be presented as part of the MIFCâ€™s ReBirth program on October 19.

	Running alongside the Lumiere Film Festival in Lyon, the MICC takes place Oct. 14-Oct. 19.

schema.headline: Spamflix to Revive Brazilâ€™s Cult â€˜Cinema of Desireâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Sean Penn on Jack Nicholson at Franceâ€™s LumiÃ¨re Fest: â€˜He Was an Angel on My Shoulderâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Introducing â€œOne Flew Over the Cuckooâ€™s Nest,â€ the curtain-raiser at this yearâ€™s LumiÃ¨re Film Festival in Lyon where he is guest of honor, Sean Penn
body:
Introducing â€œOne Flew Over the Cuckooâ€™s Nest,â€ the curtain-raiser at this yearâ€™s LumiÃ¨re Film Festival in Lyon where he is guest of honor, Sean Penn gave an emotional speech about his friend, the filmâ€™s lead actor Jack Nicholson.Â 

	â€œI heard my name a lot tonight,â€ he said. â€œBut Iâ€™ve been very comfortable with it in the sense that knowing â€œCuckooâ€™s Nestâ€ was going to play, there was no question I was going to be able to find great humility under the circumstances. One of the great, magic moments in my life in cinema was the first time I saw Jack Nicholson in MiloÅ¡ Formanâ€™s â€˜One Flew Over the Cuckooâ€™s Nest.â€™â€
	

	Â â€œI was very privileged in so much as being able to have worked with Jack twice,â€ he continued. With both â€˜The Pledgeâ€™ and â€˜Crossing Guard,â€™ he was an angel on my shoulder and I still canâ€™t quite get over, I still canâ€™t quite imagine that McMurphy [Nicholsonâ€™s character in â€œOne Flew Over the Cuckooâ€™s Nestâ€] has worked with me,â€ he smiled. Â Â 


	The film has more than stood the test of time, Penn told the crowd, recalling the first time he saw it as a teenager in Los Angeles when it was released in 1975.Â 

	â€œThere was a little cinema out by the beach in Los Angeles where I would go. At the time, in the late â€˜70s, it seemed that each film that came out was sort of an event. But still, today, I wouldnâ€™t think twice about sharing this movie with a 16 or 17 year-old because it would hold up â€“ even with those that get bored very quickly,â€ he quipped, drawing chuckles from the crowd gathered in Lyonâ€™s 5,000-seat Tony Garnier show hall, one of the festivalâ€™s key venues. Â Â 
	

	Asked by LumiÃ¨re director Thierry FrÃ©maux, who also heads the Cannes festival, whether it is still possible to make films like that today, Penn replied: â€œI have been part of the culture of complaint about where cinema has been going for a long time. But then things happen: there are two films that I am sharing here at the festival â€“ â€˜Manasâ€™ and â€˜Sentimental Valueâ€™ â€“ and [when] you see what an independently minded director still does, ignoring all the complaints, you see itâ€™s all still possible.â€ Â Â 

	Earlier in the day, Penn attended the Lyon premiere of this yearâ€™s Cannes Grand Prix winner â€œSentimental Valueâ€ together with director Joachim Trier. He will also present Marianna Brennandâ€™s debut feature, â€œManas,â€ which he executive produced.Â 

	Penn has a packed schedule while in Lyon, where he will present a new subtitled copy of his 2007 hit â€œInto the Wildâ€ and sit down for a masterclass with a LumiÃ¨re audience. Taking the stage to introduce the opening film, the actor-director seemed momentarily lost for words in the vast, sold-out concert hall: â€œI didnâ€™t expectâ€¦ [Thierry] didnâ€™t explain to me how big this situation is, I didnâ€™t realise it was like thisâ€¦.â€Â 

	The remark echoed the feeling of many first-timers at Lumiere, which draws several hundreds of thousands to see classics and contemporary films on big screens across some 30 venues.Â 

	Walking the red carpet ahead of the opening ceremony, director Scott Cooper â€“ who will premiere his new film â€œSpringsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhereâ€ at LumiÃ¨re â€“ said: â€œItâ€™s wonderful, I wish we had more [festivals like this] everywhere,â€ prompting a cry of: â€œLyon, the birthplace of cinema!â€ from Jeremy Allen White, the two-time Emmy winner who stars as The Boss in Cooperâ€™s film.

	Faithful to tradition, the festivalâ€™s 800 volunteers were feted with a walk-around the concert hall to the sound of a brass band, before guests were invited to the stage to officially open the festival by reading a sentence in unison â€“ a joyous cacophony that drew complicit laughter from the crowd.Â 

	Among the celebrities crowding the stage alongside Penn, Cooper and White were Taiwanese actor and filmmaker Shu Qi, Travis Knight, the head of Laika Studios, Costa-Gavras, Valeria Golino, three-time CÃ©sar-winner Dominique Blanc, and one enfant terrible of French cinema Bertrand Bonello (â€œSaint Laurent,â€ â€œThe Beastâ€).
	

	The LumiÃ¨re Film Festival runs in and around Lyon until Oct. 19.

schema.headline: Sean Penn on Jack Nicholson at Franceâ€™s LumiÃ¨re Fest: â€˜He Was an Angel on My Shoulderâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Seth Meyers, Tina Fey and Amy Poehler Crash Weekend Update on â€˜SNLâ€™ For â€˜Joke Offâ€™ About an Enormous Baby
description: â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ Weekend update hosts Colin Jost and Michael Che saw their desk crashed by former anchors Seth Meyers, Tina Fey and Amy Poehler
body:
â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ Weekend update hosts Colin Jost and Michael Che saw their desk crashed by former anchors Seth Meyers, Tina Fey and Amy Poehler for a â€œJoke Off.â€

	The trio stopped by to riff on a woman at a Tennessee hospital who broke a record by giving birth to a 13-pound baby. Some of the jokes included:

	*â€The baby was so big he slapped the doctor on his ass.â€


	*â€Did she give birth or did the baby drive out?â€


	*â€She broke the hospitalâ€™s record and then she broke off her husbandâ€™s penis to make sure it never happens again.â€
	

	Poehler was the episodeâ€™s host, and Fey also popped in during the nightâ€™s cold open playing Kristi Noem.

	The returning trio spent plenty of time hosting Weekend Update, as Fey was behind the desk with Jimmy Fallon from 2000â€“2004, with Fey and Poehler taking over from 2004â€“2006, and Poehler and Meyers helming the segment from 2006â€“2008. Meyers then hosted the segment solo from 2008â€“2013.

	Elsewhere in Update, Jost and Che took shots at Arbyâ€™s (â€œArbyâ€™s announced that theyâ€™re adding a new item to their menu, Steak Nuggets. Although you can make your own Steak Nuggets by eating a bunch of Arbyâ€™s.â€), Gen Z (â€œA growing number of Gen Z men are moving back in with their parents, taking over household chores and calling themselves â€˜trad sons,â€™ replacing the old name, â€˜failures.'â€) and Secretary of Health and Human Services Robert F. Kennedy Jr. (â€œRFK said this week that men who were circumcised are more likely to be autistic, which isnâ€™t surprising coming from a man who looks like heâ€™s made out of foreskin.â€)
	

	Watch the Joke Off below.

schema.headline: Seth Meyers, Tina Fey and Amy Poehler Crash Weekend Update on â€˜SNLâ€™ For â€˜Joke Offâ€™ About an Enormous Baby

title: ChloÃ© Zhao on Why Hollywood Is â€˜Not Very Good at Preserving the Language of Ambiguityâ€™ and How Neurodivergence Is Her â€˜Superpowerâ€™ in Filmmaking
description: During a conversation at London Film Festival on Sunday, Oscar-winning director ChloÃ© Zhao got candid about Hollywood, the difficulty of financing f
body:
During a conversation at London Film Festival on Sunday, Oscar-winning director ChloÃ© Zhao got candid about Hollywood, the difficulty of financing films, how neurodivergence has impacted her storytelling and more. 

	Zhaoâ€™s devastating historical drama â€œHamnetâ€ â€” about the personal tragedy that led to the creation of William Shakespeareâ€™s â€œHamlet,â€ starring Paul Mescal and Jessie Buckley â€” held its European premiere at the festival on Saturday night, where it was welcomed with plenty of emotion (and a surprise appearance from producer Steven Spielberg). Speaking about making the film, Zhao said that the experience made her â€œvery passionate about rediscovering and remembering some older ways of storytelling that have been forgotten in our society.â€
	

	â€œBefore we made everything factual and reasonable, there was a time where weâ€™d see stories in different ways â€” from our dreams, our vision quests, from going into nature and listening to the birds,â€ she said. â€œSo the language of ambiguity is, to me, vital for the health of a society. And I think even in Hollywood, in the film industry, we are not very good at preserving the language of ambiguity. If logos and mystery are in harmony, we would be living in a much better world.â€


	However, Zhao acknowledged that itâ€™s oftentimes difficult to get stories like these financed for the big screen. Though profiting from a film is not her end goal, the filmmaker acknowledged that â€œmoney is really important.â€

	â€œMaybe itâ€™s because Iâ€™m Chinese, I donâ€™t know what is it, but Iâ€™m so afraid of owing people money. I donâ€™t like it. I donâ€™t like being in debt. I want the people who put the money into my films to get the money back,â€ Zhao said. â€œI donâ€™t believe that my vision and whatever importance of my film should make people lose money. Itâ€™s just not for me. I try really hard to get financiers or studios to say, how much are you comfortable giving me so that you can survive as a company, please. And then Iâ€™ll do it within that. So I think itâ€™s really helpful because limitations, I promise, are your best friend.â€
	

	Asked by an audience member at the end of the talk how being neurodivergent has impacted the creativity of her storytelling, Zhao said proudly: â€œI think itâ€™s a superpower, I really do.â€

	â€œI think weâ€™re all on the spectrum of something. Everyoneâ€™s brain is so different, so unique â€” nature and nurture combined. And I find that I question sometimes, is it that I am the not typical one or has our world become a little too inhabitable? Is it too loud, is it too bright, is it too fast?â€ she continued. â€œSo I try to not think of it as less or different, but think about if I tune into how I function, then Iâ€™m going to create a world, not just on camera, but also off camera that is going to be healthy for me. And those who gravitate towards me like that about me, so thatâ€™s probably what they enjoy as well.â€

	She concluded: â€œItâ€™s really important and actually a good service to society for you to honor what you need first because that might be exactly what your environment might need as well.â€

	â€œHamnetâ€ world premiered at the Telluride Film Festival last month, where it made a huge splash and sparked Oscar buzz, and went on to win the Peopleâ€™s Choice Award at TIFF. In Varietyâ€˜s review, chief film critic Peter Debruge wrote that the film is â€œso emotionally raw as to be almost excruciating at times.â€

	Zhao broke through with her 2020 drama â€œNomadland,â€ starring Frances McDormand, which won the Oscars for best picture and director. With her directing win, Zhao became the first woman of color to win in the category. â€œHamnetâ€ is her latest film after directing the Marvel movie â€œEternalsâ€™ in 2021. 

	â€œHamnetâ€ will receive a limited theatrical release in the U.S. and Canada from Focus Features beginning Nov. 27 before expanding wide on Dec. 12. It will release in the U.K. on Jan. 9 via Universal Pictures.

schema.headline: ChloÃ© Zhao on Why Hollywood Is â€˜Not Very Good at Preserving the Language of Ambiguityâ€™ and How Neurodivergence Is Her â€˜Superpowerâ€™ in Filmmaking

title: Feds Clap Back at Chappell Roan Saying 'F**** ICE' at Concert
description:
Chappell Roan
                          'F*** ICE Forever' ...
                          Feds Cla
body:
Chappell Roan
                          'F*** ICE Forever' ...
                          Feds Clap Back!!!
                      
                  
                        Published October 11, 2025 5:34 PM PDT
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The feds are firing back at Chappell Roan after she said it's "f*** ICE forever" at a concert ... and the Department of Homeland Security says the singer needs to "get a grip."
      
    
          Chappell was performing Friday night at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, CA when she told the crowd "F*** ICE."
      
    
          Waiting for your permission to load TikTok Post.
      
    
          In video from the concert, the crowd cheers and supports the "Pink Pony Club" singer's thoughts on the immigration raids that have terrorized communities in California, Chicago and beyond.
      
    
          But the Department of Homeland Security and ICE ain't laughing.
      
    
          DHS assistant secretary for public affairs Tricia McLaughlin tells TMZ ... "Pink Pony Club is good. Pedophiles are bad. That's who weâ€™re getting off of our streets. Get a grip."
      

      
        
              
    
    
          McLaughlin did not cite any statistics, but here's some numbers to chew on ... a recent study from the Cato Institute found 65% of people detained by ICE from October 1, 2024 to mid-June this year have never committed a crime.
      
    
          ICE is nabbing sex offenders in the immigration raids, but a lot of hardworking folks are getting swept up too. Just sayin'. ğŸ¤·ğŸ½â€â™‚ï¸
      
      
              
          
                          
                Chappell Roan

schema.headline: Feds Clap Back at Chappell Roan Saying 'F**** ICE' at Concert

title: Mass Shooting at South Carolina Bar Leaves 4 Dead, 20 Injured
description:
South Carolina Mass Shooting
                          4 Dead, 20 Injured
body:
South Carolina Mass Shooting
                          4 Dead, 20 Injured
                      
                  
                        Published October 12, 2025 7:04 AM PDT
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          A night out turned into tragedy in South Carolina, after gunfire erupted at a packed bar, leaving 4 people dead and at least 20 injured.
      
    
          According to law enforcement, the shooting broke out late Saturday night into early Sunday at Willie's Bar & Grill on St. Helena Island, where hundreds of people were gathered. When first responders arrived, they found a large, chaotic crowd and multiple victims suffering from gunshot wounds.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Authorities say four victims were pronounced dead at the scene, while four others are fighting for their lives in critical condition at the hospital.
      

          Witnesses told investigators that as the shooting started, terrified patrons ran for cover, with several fleeing into nearby businesses and homes to escape the gunfire.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          It's still unclear what sparked the shooting or whether anyone has been taken into custody. The Beaufort County Sheriffâ€™s Office says the investigation is ongoing as detectives work to identify the suspect(s).
